byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

abstract: Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr's speech in 1992, in which the then-senator argued against any Supreme Court appointment during presidential campaign, is giving Republicans upper hand in current battle to replace Justice Antonin Scalia.
lead_paragraph: Though remarks Mr. Biden made in 1992 are unlikely to stop the White House from submitting a nominee, Republicans appeared to gain an advantage in the looming battle.

headline.main: Joe Biden Speech From 1992 Gives G.O.P. Fodder in Court Fight
headline.print_headline: Biden Speech in 1992 Gives G.O.P. Fodder in Court Fight

snippet: Though remarks Mr. Biden made in 1992 are unlikely to stop the White House from submitting a nominee, Republicans appeared to gain an advantage in the looming battle.
